quotes.quote: Walk away quietly in any direction and taste the freedom of the mountaineer. Camp out among the grasses and gentians of glacial meadows, in craggy garden nooks full of nature's darlings.
There are two kinds of climbers, those who climb because their heart sings when they're in the mountains, and all the rest.
No matter how sophisticated you may be, a large granite mountain cannot be denied—it speaks in silence to the very core of your being.

Set loose, a child would run down the paths, scramble up the rocks, lie on the earth. Grown-ups more often let their minds do the running, scrambling, and lying, but the emotion is shared. It feels good to be here.
If you are seeking creative ideas, go out walking. Angels whisper to a man when he goes for a walk.
In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.
Mountains have a way of dealing with overconfidence.
Thousands of tired, nerve-shaken, over-civilized people are beginning to find out that going to the mountains is going home; that wildness is a necessity.
May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view. May your mountains rise into and above the clouds.
You need mountains, long staircases don't make good hikers.
I like being near the top of a mountain. One can't get lost here.
Mountains are the cathedrals where I practice my religion.
The experienced mountain climber is not intimidated by a mountainhe is inspired by it.
Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.
Mountain hikes instilled in me a life-long urge to get to the top of any inviting summit or peak.
Jumping from boulder to boulder and never falling, with a heavy pack, is easier than it sounds; you just can't fall when you get into the rhythm of the dance.
You never climb the same mountain twice, not even in memory. Memory rebuilds the mountain, changes the weather, retells the jokes, remakes all the moves.
Mountains are not stadiums where I satisfy my ambition to achieve, they are the cathedrals where I practice my religion.

I walked slowly to enjoy this freedom, and when I came out of the mountains, I saw the sky over the prairie, and I thought that if heaven was real, I hoped it was a place I never had to go, for this earth was greater than any paradise.
Great things are done when men and mountains meet; This is not done by jostling in the street.

On a hike, the days pass with the wind, the sun, the stars; movement is powered by a belly full of food and water, not a noxious tankful of fossil fuels. On a hike, you're less a job title and more a human being. A periodic hike not only stretches the limbs but also reminds us: Wow, there's a big old world out there.
Climbing is as close as we can come to flying.
The higher you climb on the mountain, the harder the wind blows.
Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees.
Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
Hiking and happiness go hand in hand or foot in boot.
Me thinks that the moment my legs begin to move, my thoughts begin to flow.
You need special shoes for hiking—and a bit of a special soul as well.
The long distance hiker, a breed set apart, from the likes of the usual pack. He'll shoulder his gear, be hittin' the trail; Long gone, long 'fore he'll be back.
Never measure the height of a mountain until you have reached the top. Then you will see how low it was.

Climb the mountains and get their good tidings. Nature's peace will flow into you as sunshine flows into trees. The winds will blow their own freshness into you, and the storms their energy, while cares will drop away from you like the leaves of Autumn.
Trekking means a travelling experience with a thrilling excitement.

I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
Somewhere between the bottom of the climb and the summit is the answer to the mystery why we climb.
Nobody climbs mountains for scientific reasons. Science is used to raise money for the expeditions, but you really climb for the hell of it.
Mountains are the beginning and the end of all natural scenery.
It's not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
Returning home is the most difficult part of long-distance hiking; You have grown outside the puzzle and your piece no longer fits.
Remember that time spent on a rock climb isn't subtracted from your life span.
When preparing to climb a mountain—pack a light heart.
Hiking is the best workout! You can hike for three hours and not even realize you're working out. And, hiking alone lets me have some time to myself.
Getting to the top is optional. Getting down is mandatory.
Study nature, love nature, stay close to nature. It will never fail you.
Many climbers become writers because of the misconceptions about climbing.
After a day's walk everything has twice its usual value.
The mountains are calling and I must go.
I see my path, but I don't know where it leads. Not knowing where I'm going is what inspires me to travel it.
Hiking is just walking where it's okay to pee.
Just walkin', hiking the streets of the sky.
If it's going hiking then I'm going hiking. To the other places that we never had.
I have reached the conclusion while hiking the pike though I try and I try.
Start your hiking mile and stay away.
I'm looking at the top I'm just eyeing the spot and I just keep climbing I been hiking a lot.
Hiking in the mountains, romantic rendezvous.
Tasting smells and colors, hiking mounts crossing rivers. Humble biped you've come undone.
Need a hiking trip to get where I live.
Be easy now, go hiking through the hills in a summer gown Raise the kids, peace within and make our sound.
Losing all sense of proportion is one of the inevitable consequences of hiking in the mountains for any extended period of time.
Every good hike brings you eventually back home.
